intro: Dryadodaphne novoguineensis subsp. novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea dryadodaphne, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
